 The *Drinfeld period domain of rank* `r > 1` is
 defined by
 
 .. MATH::
 
     \Omega^r(\mathbb{C}_{\infty}) :=
     \mathbb{P}^{r-1}(\mathbb{C}_{\infty})
-    \setminus \mathbb{P}^{r-1}(K_{\infty}).
+    \setminus \{K_{\infty}\text{-rational hyperplanes}\}.
 
 This space is a rigid analytic space
 and plays the role of the complex upper half plane. We identify the elements
 of `\Omega^r(\mathbb{C}_{\infty})` with the set of column vectors
 `(w_1,\ldots, w_{r-1}, w_{r})^{\mathrm{T}}` in `\mathbb{C}_{\infty}^r`
 such that the `w_i` are `K_{\infty}`-linearly independant and
 `w_r = \xi`, a nonzero constant in `\mathbb{C}_{\infty}`.

-<span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">drinfeld_modular_forms.expansions.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">compute_delta_rank_2</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">polynomial_ring</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">name</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">'t'</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#drinfeld_modular_forms.expansions.compute_delta_rank_2" title="Permalink to this definition">#</a></dt>
+<span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">drinfeld_modular_forms.expansions.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">compute_delta_rank_2</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">param</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">name</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">'t'</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#drinfeld_modular_forms.expansions.compute_delta_rank_2" title="Permalink to this definition">#</a></dt>
 <dd><p>Return the expansion of the normalized Drinfeld modular discriminant of
 rank 2.</p>
 <p>Recall that for <span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(w\in \Omega^2(\mathbb{C}_{\infty})\)</span> the <em>Drinfeld modular
 discriminant</em> is the leading coefficient of the Drinfeld module</p>
 <div class="math-wrapper docutils container">
 <div class="math notranslate nohighlight">
 \[\phi_{w} : T \mapsto T + g(z)\tau + \Delta(w)\tau^2\]</div>
 </div>
 <p>corresponding to the lattice <span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(\Lambda_w := wA + A\)</span>. The <em>normalized</em>
 discriminant is the form <span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(\Delta_0(w)\)</span> such that its first nonzero
 coefficient is 1.</p>
 <p>INPUT:</p>
 <ul class="simple">
-<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">polynomial_ring</span></code>  a univariate polynomial ring over a finite field.</p></li>
-<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">name</span></code>  string (default: t).</p></li>
+<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">param</span></code>  a prime power, a univariate polynomial ring over
+<span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(\mathbb{F}_q\)</span> or the fraction field of such polynomial ring.</p></li>
+<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">name</span></code> (string, default: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">'t'</span></code>)  represent the parameter at
+infinity.</p></li>
 </ul>
 <p>OUTPUT: a lazy power series over the base ring.</p>
 <div class="admonition note">
 <p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
 <p>We have <span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(\Delta_0(w) = f_{q^2 - 1, q - 1}\)</span>.</p>
 </div>
 <p>EXAMPLES:</p>
 <div class="highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">drinfeld_modular_forms</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">compute_delta_rank_2</span>
-<span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">A</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">GF</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="s1">&#39;T&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span>
-<span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">D</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">compute_delta_rank_2</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">A</span><span class="p">);</span> <span class="n">D</span>
+<span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">q</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">3</span>
+<span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">D</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">compute_delta_rank_2</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">q</span><span class="p">);</span> <span class="n">D</span>
 <span class="n">t</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">2</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">6</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">O</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">)</span>
 <span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">D</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">38</span><span class="p">]</span>
 <span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">18</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">12</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">10</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">4</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">1</span>
 <span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">D</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">56</span><span class="p">]</span>
 <span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">27</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">3</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">T</span>
 </pre></div>
 </div>
 </dd></dl>
 
 <dl class="py function">
 <dt class="sig sig-object py" id="drinfeld_modular_forms.expansions.compute_eisentein_series_rank_2">
-<span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">drinfeld_modular_forms.expansions.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">compute_eisentein_series_rank_2</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">polynomial_ring</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">name</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">'t'</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#drinfeld_modular_forms.expansions.compute_eisentein_series_rank_2" title="Permalink to this definition">#</a></dt>
+<span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">drinfeld_modular_forms.expansions.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">compute_eisentein_series_rank_2</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">param</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">name</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">'t'</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#drinfeld_modular_forms.expansions.compute_eisentein_series_rank_2" title="Permalink to this definition">#</a></dt>
 <dd><p>Return the expansion fo the normalized Drinfeld Eisenstein series of
 weight <span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(q-1\)</span>.</p>
 <p>Recall that this form is defined by:</p>
 <div class="math-wrapper docutils container">
 <div class="math notranslate nohighlight">
 \[E_{q-1}(w) := \frac{T^q - T}{\tilde{\pi}^{q-1}} \sum_{(c, d)\in A^2\setminus 0} \frac{1}{(cw + d)^{q-1}}.\]</div>
 </div>
 <p>where <span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(\tilde{\pi}\)</span> is the Carlitz period.</p>
 <p>INPUT:</p>
 <ul class="simple">
-<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">polynomial_ring</span></code>  a univariate polynomial ring over a finite field.</p></li>
-<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">name</span></code>  string (default: t).</p></li>
+<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">param</span></code>  a prime power, a univariate polynomial ring over
+<span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(\mathbb{F}_q\)</span> or the fraction field of such polynomial ring.</p></li>
+<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">name</span></code> (string, default: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">'t'</span></code>)  represent the parameter at
+infinity.</p></li>
 </ul>
 <p>OUTPUT: a lazy power series over the base ring.</p>
 <div class="admonition note">
 <p class="admonition-title">Note</p>
 <p>We have <span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(E_{q-1} = 1 - (T^q - T)f_{q - 1, q - 1}\)</span>.</p>
 </div>
 <p>EXAMPLES:</p>
 <div class="highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">drinfeld_modular_forms</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">compute_eisentein_series_rank_2</span>

 <span class="mi">1</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">((</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">O</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">7</span><span class="p">)</span>

 <dl class="py function">
 <dt class="sig sig-object py" id="drinfeld_modular_forms.expansions.compute_h_rank_2">

+<span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">drinfeld_modular_forms.expansions.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">compute_h_rank_2</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">param</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">name</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">'t'</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#drinfeld_modular_forms.expansions.compute_h_rank_2" title="Permalink to this definition">#</a></dt>
+<dd><p>Return the expansion of the function <span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(h\)</span> defined by
+<span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(\Delta = h^{q-1}\)</span> and having an expansion of the form <span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(t + O(t^2)\)</span>.</p>
+<p>INPUT:</p>
+<ul class="simple">
+<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">param</span></code>  a prime power, a univariate polynomial ring over
+<span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(\mathbb{F}_q\)</span> or the fraction field of such polynomial ring.</p></li>
+<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">name</span></code> (string, default: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">'t'</span></code>)  represent the parameter at
+infinity.</p></li>
+</ul>
+<p>EXAMPLES:</p>
+<div class="highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">drinfeld_modular_forms</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">compute_h_rank_2</span>
+<span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">q</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">3</span>
+<span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">h</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">compute_h_rank_2</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">q</span><span class="p">);</span> <span class="n">h</span>
+<span class="n">t</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">5</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">((</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">7</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">O</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">)</span>
+<span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">h</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">15</span><span class="p">]</span>
+<span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">3</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">T</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">3</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">6</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">4</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">2</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
+</pre></div>
+</div>
+</dd></dl>
 
 <dl class="py function">
 <dt class="sig sig-object py" id="drinfeld_modular_forms.expansions.compute_petrov_expansion">
-<span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">drinfeld_modular_forms.expansions.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">compute_petrov_expansion</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">k</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">n</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">polynomial_ring</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">name</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">'t'</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#drinfeld_modular_forms.expansions.compute_petrov_expansion" title="Permalink to this definition">#</a></dt>
-<dd><p>Return the <span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(A\)</span>-expansion of the form <span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(f_{k, n}\)</span> as a lazy power series.</p>
+<span class="sig-prename descclassname"><span class="pre">drinfeld_modular_forms.expansions.</span></span><span class="sig-name descname"><span class="pre">compute_petrov_expansion</span></span><span class="sig-paren">(</span><em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">k</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">n</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">param</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">name</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">'t'</span></span></em>, <em class="sig-param"><span class="n"><span class="pre">check</span></span><span class="o"><span class="pre">=</span></span><span class="default_value"><span class="pre">True</span></span></em><span class="sig-paren">)</span><a class="headerlink" href="#drinfeld_modular_forms.expansions.compute_petrov_expansion" title="Permalink to this definition">#</a></dt>
+<dd><p>Return the <span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(A\)</span>-expansion of the form <span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(f_{k, n}\)</span> as a lazy power
+series.</p>
+<p>Recall that it is defined by:</p>
+<div class="math-wrapper docutils container">
+<div class="math notranslate nohighlight">
+\[\begin{split}f_{k, n} =
+\sum_{\substack{a\in \mathbb{F}_q[T] \\ a\text{ monic}}}
+a^{k - n}G_n(t(az))\end{split}\]</div>
+</div>
 <p>INPUT:</p>
 <ul class="simple">
-<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">k</span></code>  an integer representing the weight of the resulting form.</p></li>
-<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">n</span></code>  an integer which will be congruent to the type modulo <span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(q-1\)</span>.</p></li>
-<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">polynomial_ring</span></code>  a univariate polynomial ring over a finite field.</p></li>
-<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">name</span></code>  string (default: t).</p></li>
+<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">k</span></code>  an integer equal to the weight of the resulting form.</p></li>
+<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">n</span></code>  an integer congruent to the type modulo <span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(q-1\)</span>.</p></li>
+<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">param</span></code>  a prime power, a univariate polynomial ring over
+<span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(\mathbb{F}_q\)</span> or the fraction field of such polynomial ring.</p></li>
+<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">name</span></code> (string, default: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">'t'</span></code>)  represent the parameter at
+infinity.</p></li>
+<li><p><code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">check</span></code> (Boolean, default: <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">True</span></code>)  If this parameter is set
+to <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">True</span></code>, the code will check if  <span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(k\)</span> and <span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(n\)</span> verify the three
+conditions:</p>
+<ul>
+<li><p><span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(k - 2n &gt; 0\)</span>;</p></li>
+<li><p><span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(q - 1\)</span> divides <span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(k - 2n\)</span>;</p></li>
+<li><p><span class="math notranslate nohighlight">\(n &gt; p^{v_p(k - n)}\)</span>.</p></li>
 </ul>
-<p>OUTPUT: A lazy power series over the fraction field of <code class="docutils literal notranslate"><span class="pre">polynomial_ring</span></code>.</p>
+</li>
+</ul>
+<p>OUTPUT: A lazy power series.</p>
 <p>EXAMPLES:</p>
 <div class="highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">drinfeld_modular_forms</span> <span class="kn">import</span> <span class="n">compute_petrov_expansion</span>
-<span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">A</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">GF</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="s1">&#39;T&#39;</span><span class="p">]</span>
-<span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">D</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">compute_petrov_expansion</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">A</span><span class="p">);</span> <span class="n">D</span>
+<span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">q</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mi">3</span>
+<span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">D</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">compute_petrov_expansion</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">q</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">q</span><span class="p">);</span> <span class="n">D</span>
 <span class="n">t</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">t</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">5</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="p">((</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">3</span><span class="o">+</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="p">)</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">7</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">O</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">8</span><span class="p">)</span>
 </pre></div>
 </div>
 <p>To obtain more coefficient, one just need to take slices the series:</p>
-<div class="highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">D</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># output the coefficient from i=0...9</span>
+<div class="highlight-default notranslate"><div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">D</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">:</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># output the coefficients from i=0...9</span>
 <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">3</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">T</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
 <span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">D</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">39</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># print the 39-th coefficient</span>
 <span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">9</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">3</span>
 <span class="n">sage</span><span class="p">:</span> <span class="n">D</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">59</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># 59-th coefficient</span>
 <span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">27</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">9</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="n">T</span><span class="o">^</span><span class="mi">3</span> <span class="o">+</span> <span class="mi">2</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="n">T</span>
 </pre></div>
